snippet: As lawyers for a Texas death row inmate try to stop his execution, even death penalty critics grudgingly agree that Texas kills with efficiency.
abstract: Lawyers for Texas death row inmate Robert James Campbell try to stop his execution based on bungled Oklahoma execution, but even death penalty critics grudgingly agree that Texas kills with efficiency; Texas accounts for nearly 40 percent of nation's executions, with 515 inmates killed since 1982 at prison in Huntsville.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and JOHN SCHWARTZ

lead_paragraph: As lawyers for a Texas death row inmate try to stop his execution, even death penalty critics grudgingly agree that Texas kills with efficiency.

headline.main: Confronted on Execution, Texas Proudly Says It Kills Efficiently
headline.print_headline: Confronted on Execution, Texas Proudly Says It Kills Efficiently
